So...  Bot lane as the place Support goes isn't arbitrary by any means.  Dragon control is a key element to winning in late game, and you just don't have control over the dragon or the ability to take/steal the dragon if you threw someone down there solo. It's all about communication.

Xayah and Rakan's love is not relevant to the game nor is Lucian's desire to murder Thresh because he killed his wife. Hell, all lore is irrelevant to gameplay. 

However, this is a videogame. Videogames are a unique medium in that they combine movie, written, and interactive elements together to deliver an entertainment experience as a unified package that is part gameplay, part art, part audio, and tells a story. If you forego chunks of these elements, you have a low quality or generally poorly delivered game. Gameplay is but one element of a videogame, but the written, audio, and visual elements outside of the gameplay also need to exist coherently to deliver the experience. That's why I will never understand why people seem to think only gameplay is important in the media that is comprised of pretty much almost all other forms of entertainment media. 

If you do not want the other parts that comprise a videogame experience and only want gameplay, play checkers.
